title: The autobiography and letters of Mrs. M.O.W. Oliphant /
author: Oliphant
snippet: Now for a beginning. I remember nothing of Wallyford, where I was born, but opened my eyes to life, so far as I remember, in the village of Lasswade, where we lived inr a little house, I think, on the road to Dalkeith. I recollect the wintry road 'ending to my consciousness 'in a slight ascent with 1 This is exactly what Sir Walter says in his Diary, only published in 'Sc a so 1 was like him in this without knowing it.

title: Selections from the family papers preserved at Caldwell
snippet: Tytler of Woodhouselee, Clerk. Finlay of Wallyford. Buchan of Letham.
